title: 'Want to live, but what can I do?': UP BLO dies by suicide, another of heart attack amid ‚ÄòSIR stress‚Äô
content: Two Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in Uttar Pradesh have died while working on electoral roll revisions, one by suicide and another from a heart attack. These incidents bring the total BLO deaths during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise to at least seven, raising concerns about workload and pressure.

title: 'Speak to a doctor': RS witnesses Kharge vs Nadda over Dhankhar's 'sudden exit' ‚Äî watch
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed a heated exchange between Mallikarjun Kharge and JP Nadda on the first day of the Winter Session. Kharge's reference to the "sudden exit" of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar drew sharp criticism from Nadda, who advised him to seek medical help for political frustrations.

title: Breakfast pe charcha? Now, DKS 'invites' Sidda for meet
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is slated to visit Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar's residence on December 2, signaling a temporary truce amid internal power tussle. This meeting follows Shivakumar's recent visit to the CM's residence, both aimed at projecting unity as directed by the Congress high command. The move seeks to cool tensions before the legislature session begins.

title: Trump tariffs hit India‚Äôs manufacturing sector! PMI falls to 9-month low in Nov
content: US tariffs have slowed India's manufacturing growth to a nine-month low, impacting sales and production. While exports to other regions remain strong, new export orders saw their slowest rise in over a year. India is negotiating a trade framework with the US to address these tariff challenges, though future output expectations have dipped.

title: Vintage Virat Kohli: 'Mentally young, hungry, unstoppable' ‚Äî SA great delivers powerful verdict
content: Former South African pacer Dale Steyn lauded Virat Kohli's enduring ODI relevance, highlighting his "mentally young, fresh, and hungry" approach after a match-winning 135. Steyn emphasised Kohli's vast experience and unwavering self-belief, noting the star batter's palpable excitement for playing for India, even at 37. This stellar performance powered India to a 17-run victory.

title: ‚ÄòWe stumbled on one giant secret‚Äô: Sam Altman on ChatGPT‚Äôs breakthrough moment
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman described ChatGPT's launch as a 'scientific windfall' and a defining moment, attributing its success to scaling laws for language models.  The company is now making an aggressive infrastructure bet, partnering with industry giants like Nvidia and Oracle to build massive computing capacity, aiming to become 'people's personal AI subscription'.

title: 'Payment for betrayal': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
content: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: Drunk Kerala techie sexually harasses cabin crew on flight
content: A passenger on an Air India flight from Dubai to Hyderabad was apprehended by airport police following allegations of sexual harassment and leaving obscene messages. The accused, identified as Biniyam Nazar, reportedly touched a stewardess inappropriately and left offensive remarks. Authorities registered a case under relevant sections of the law.

title: Ahmedabad man fires six rounds at in-laws‚Äô home after quarrel with wife
content: Panic erupted in Ahmedabad's Subhash Society after Rahul Soni fired six rounds following a domestic dispute with his wife. Soni arrived at his in-laws' residence, argued with his wife, and then discharged firearms outside the bungalow. Police detained Soni and seized the weapons, with no injuries reported.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: Mumbai businesswoman held at gunpoint, stripped, threatened by pharma officials
content: A Mumbai businesswoman has accused senior pharmaceutical officials of holding her at gunpoint, stripping her, and taking compromising photos and videos at their Mahalaxmi office. The FIR details threats of viral dissemination and fabricated legal cases. Police have registered a case under various sections of sexual violence and criminal intimidation, initiating an investigation.

title: Explainer: Making sense of India‚Äôs 8.2% growth - and IMF‚Äôs ‚ÄòC‚Äô on GDP data
content: India's economy is reportedly growing at an impressive 8.2%, yet the IMF has assigned its national accounts a 'C' grade due to methodological weaknesses. This rating highlights concerns about outdated base years, price deflators, and data granularity, sparking a debate over the accuracy of the reported growth figures.

title: December 2025 school holidays: Winter vacation, Christmas and more -- check list
content: December ushers in a calmer rhythm for schools across India as exams wind down and winter break approaches. With holidays typically falling between December 20 and 31, students look forward to Christmas festivities, year-end events and a brief pause before the new academic rush begins in January. The month brings a mix of festive charm, rest and school-level transitions.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.

title: China-Japan tensions flare: Maki Otsuki's concert abruptly stopped in Shanghai ‚Äî watch
content: Japanese singer Maki Otsuki's Shanghai concert was abruptly halted mid-performance due to rising diplomatic tensions between China and Japan. The incident follows remarks by Japan's prime minister regarding Taiwan, leading to Beijing's strong reaction and a wave of cultural exchange cancellations, including other Japanese artists' shows.

title: ‚ÄòHigh probability‚Äô: Musk suggests our reality may be simulation
content: Tech mogul Elon Musk believes humanity likely lives in a simulation, citing the rapid evolution of video games from simple graphics to photorealistic experiences. He argues that if this trend continues, simulated realities will become indistinguishable from our own. Musk previously shared this 'simulation hypothesis' on Joe Rogan's podcast, suggesting our existence points to this possibility.

title: Leon Draisaitl‚Äôs sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid‚Äôs leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Kerala deputy SP suspended for molesting woman in custody, taking bribes
content: A Deputy SP in Kerala, A. Umesh, has been suspended. Allegations of sexual assault and bribery against him emerged after a police officer's suicide. An internal inquiry found Umesh misused his position. The Home Department suspended him based on the state police chief's recommendation. This action follows a review of a special report detailing grave misconduct. Disciplinary action is pending.

title: Pune shocker: Cab driver kills partner over marriage pressure, burns body; arrested
content: A 33-year-old cab driver was arrested for allegedly murdering his married partner in Pune and setting her body ablaze in Dharashiv district. The suspect confessed to killing the woman, who was reportedly pressuring him for marriage, to escape the relationship. He then transported her body and set it on fire.

title: Haryana youth stabbed to death in UK: 6 arrested suspects granted bail
content: A Haryana family seeks government help to bring home the body of Vijay Kumar Sheoran. The 29-year-old student died in the UK after a stabbing incident. His brother has written to the External Affairs Ministry for urgent assistance. The family hopes for his last rites to be performed in their village.

title: Winter Session: PM Modi welcomes Vice-President CP Radhakrishnan as Parliament opens ‚Äî Watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan to the Rajya Sabha on the first day of Winter Session, highlighting his dedication to social service and his connection with tribal communities in Jharkhand. PM Modi assured the House's cooperation, emphasizing decorum and policy over slogans, while also urging the opposition to move past recent election defeats.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal rises; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver futures opened strongly on Monday, buoyed by a weakening dollar, anticipated US Federal Reserve rate cuts, and a depreciating rupee. Silver futures reached a new peak, with analysts expecting continued strong momentum driven by global economic factors and currency fluctuations.

title: 'Why talk about Kohli's future?': India coach shuts down noise; hints at 2027 WC plans
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak firmly dismissed speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's ODI future, emphasising his current form, fitness, and crucial contributions. Kotak stated that discussions about the 2027 World Cup are premature, as the team focuses on present performance. He highlighted Kohli's recent century as proof of his continued value, assuring that the veteran remains central to India's plans.

title: Red Fort blast probe widens: NIA raids ‚ÄòMadam Surgeon‚Äô; Lucknow home searched
content: NIA widened its probe into a "white-collar" terror network linked to the Red Fort blast, conducting searches in Jammu & Kashmir and Uttar Pradesh. The investigation focuses on a sophisticated module involving educated professionals accused of funneling funds for terror activities, with former medical faculty Dr. Shaheen Shahid among those arrested.

title: Govt to replace GST compensation cess on tobacco, pan masala; Here's what you should know
content: Parliament's Winter Session sees the government proposing new excise duty on tobacco and a 'Health Security‚ÄìNational Security Cess' for pan masala. These measures aim to maintain tax revenue post-GST compensation cess expiry, ensuring continued fiscal space for public health and national security initiatives. The shift aligns with a new 40% GST slab for demerit goods.

title: Oxford word of the year: It's ‚Äòrage bait‚Äô ‚Äî here's what it means
content: Oxford University Press has declared 'rage bait' the Word of the Year 2025, citing a threefold surge in online usage. This term describes content intentionally crafted to provoke anger and boost engagement.  Its selection highlights a significant shift in how online attention, interaction, and ethics are perceived and manipulated in the digital sphere.

title: 'Even husbands don‚Äôt give Rs 100': Maha minister asks Ladki Bahin beneficiaries to 'stay loyal' to CM
content: Maharashtra minister Jaykumar Gore urged women beneficiaries of the Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin scheme to vote for Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. Addressing a rally, Gore advised women to accept money from any source but to remember the Rs 1,500 monthly stipend, warning it would stop if Fadnavis wasn't in power. He emphasized loyalty to the CM during upcoming civic polls.

title: Anthony Davis shares heartfelt 3-word message to JJ Redick after Lakers clash
content: Anthony Davis expressed strong admiration for his former coach, JJ Redick, after facing him for the first time post-trade.  Despite the Lakers' loss to the Mavericks, Davis highlighted their enduring bond, recalling Redick's debut season as a learning experience for both.  This encounter underscored the mutual respect between the two as their NBA careers progress.

title: ‚ÄòWant father, brothers to be hanged‚Äô: Teen 'marries' boyfriend‚Äôs corpse
content: A 18-year-old woman in Nanded accused her father and brothers of murdering her 25-year-old Buddhist boyfriend due to their inter-caste relationship. She performed symbolic wedding rituals before his funeral and demanded capital punishment for the accused. Police have arrested the family members and others involved in the brutal killing.

title: Delhi-NCR AQI 8-year best: Pollution dips between Jan and Nov; only 3 ‚Äòsevere‚Äô days in 2025
content: Delhi-NCR breathes easier this year, achieving its best air quality in eight years, excluding 2020.  Average AQI and severe pollution days have significantly dropped.  PM2.5 and PM10 levels are also at their lowest since 2018.  Revised GRAP guidelines now place stricter measures under Stage III, impacting office operations.  However, allegations of data manipulation and lax enforcement have surfaced.

title: Will Virat Kohli return to Tests? Cricketer gives blunt reply: ‚ÄòYes, I'm just playing one form‚Äô
content: Virat Kohli's match-winning century in the first ODI against South Africa sparked speculation about a potential Test comeback. However, the star batter firmly stated his commitment to playing only one format of the game. Kohli emphasised his mental approach to cricket and the importance of enjoyment in his continued success.

title: ‚ÄòYou must leave the country now‚Äô: Trump delivers blunt ultimatum to Maduro on call
content: President Trump issued an ultimatum to Venezuela's Nicol√°s Maduro, offering safe passage in exchange for immediate departure. Maduro reportedly refused, demanding global amnesty and control of the armed forces, leading to collapsed talks. Trump acknowledged speaking with Maduro but offered no details, later warning of Venezuelan airspace closure amid escalating US military presence and accusations of fueling a drug crisis.

title: TOI impact: 1972 rape survivor ‚ÄòMathura‚Äô to receive Rs 10 lakh aid, pension
content: A 1972 rape survivor, whose case led to landmark legal reforms, was found living in dire conditions. A TOI report sparked immediate action from Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and widespread support from across India and abroad. Authorities have pledged financial aid, housing, and rations, offering a lifeline to the woman known as 'Mathura'.

title: Quit govt job, went to UK for studies: Haryana student stabbed to death
content: A 30-year-old Indian student from Haryana, Vijay Kumar Sheoran, was fatally stabbed in Worcester, UK. He had moved to the UK for higher studies earlier this year. His family has appealed to the Ministry of External Affairs for assistance in repatriating his body for final rites.

title: Scared of losing money? How to start investing even when you are afraid - explained
content: Many fear investing due to market volatility and potential losses. However, data shows long-term equity investments typically reward patience, while inaction risks losing purchasing power to inflation. Protecting yourself with an emergency fund and insurance, then starting small with a diversified fund, helps manage fear and build wealth over time through consistent, disciplined behaviour.

title: Shifting visa pattern: H-1B nod for IT firms drops to 4.5k - lowest in a decade
content: Top Indian IT firms saw a significant 70% drop in H-1B initial employment approvals for FY 2025. Tech giants like Amazon and Meta now dominate new H-1B approvals, signaling a major shift in the visa landscape. This trend suggests a focus on retaining existing employees rather than bringing in new talent.

title: Man who fought for 'right to die' ends life through assisted death at 92
content: Ludwig Minelli, the founder of Swiss right-to-die group Dignitas, has died through an assisted death at the age of 92. Minelli, who established Dignitas in 1998, dedicated his final years to exploring new avenues for end-of-life choices. The organization will continue his legacy, upholding principles of self-determination and freedom of choice.

title: IND vs SA: 'Virat, Rohit make oppositions look silly' ‚Äî Rahul says it's fun having them around
content: KL Rahul expressed admiration and nerves after Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's stellar performances secured India's 17-run victory over South Africa in the opening ODI. Kohli's 135 and Rohit's 57 anchored India's 349/8, with bowlers Harshit Rana and Kuldeep Yadav also playing crucial roles in the tense win.

title: NRs 50, 500 and 1,000: Nepal awards new banknotes contract to China
content: Nepal's central bank has awarded a contract to a Chinese firm for printing new banknotes. The company will design and supply notes of NRs 50, NRs 500, and NRs 1,000. This comes as Nepal also issued new Rs 100 notes featuring a revised map including disputed territories. The Chinese firm has prior experience printing Nepalese currency.

title: Delhi blast probe: NIA raids 8 J&K spots; searches on at suspect Jasir Bilal Wani‚Äôs home
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) and local police conducted coordinated raids at eight locations across Delhi on Monday, including the residence of key suspect Jasir Bilal Wani. The operation is reportedly connected to a "white collar terror" network, with multiple teams conducting simultaneous searches. Further details are expected as the investigation progresses.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 26,250; BSE Sensex near 86,000
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on the back of strong domestic fundamentals and better-than-expected GDP growth numbers.

title: Shubman Gill's fitness: India captain to begin rehab at CoE; likely to resume batting this week
content: Shubman Gill is set to begin his rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru from December 1. The 26-year-old, who missed the Test and ODI series against South Africa due to a neck injury, is recovering well and will start training soon. His participation in the upcoming T20I series depends on his full recovery and readiness.

title: Tamil Nadu bus crash: 9 women among 11 killed as 2 govt buses collide
content: A catastrophic crash involving two government buses in Tirupattur has led to a grim toll of 11 fatalities, among them nine women, and inflicted injuries on 54 individuals. The incident, triggered by a driver trying to dodge a pedestrian, caused a traffic standstill lasting half an hour. Chief Minister M.K.

title: QB Rodgers calls out WRs after 'boo-worthy' loss
content: After an injured Aaron Rodgers finished one of the worst passing games of his career, the Steelers QB said he hopes his wide receivers show up during the next film sessions and run the right routes.

title: Bonitto seals win after Broncos switch up call on D
content: After the Broncos tweaked their defensive call during a timeout, linebacker Nick Bonitto swatted away Marcus Mariota's pass on a 2-point conversion attempt to preserve Denver's 27-26 overtime win against Washington on Sunday night.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Sources: Spartans target Fitzgerald as new coach
content: Pat Fitzgerald, 50, has emerged as the target of Michigan State's coaching search, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday night, confirming a report, and the sides are working toward a deal, which is expected to be finalized in the near future.

title: Sources: Kentucky expected to fire Mark Stoops
content: Kentucky is expected to fire football coach Mark Stoops, sources told ESPN on Sunday, with the process set to formally play out Monday.

title: Titans' Chestnut says Jags punter threatened him
content: Titans running back Julius Chestnut alleged that Jaguars punter Logan Cooke threatened to kill him during Sunday's game. "I was just trying to play hard, and he came up to me and said he was going to kill me," Chestnut said.

title: 76ers' Embiid returns in chaotic 2OT loss to Hawks
content: Joel Embiid, Paul George and Tyrese Maxey shared the court for the first time this season Sunday night, but that became a footnote in a chaotic double-overtime loss to the Hawks.

title: üîé How Kiffin's decision impacted sports books
content: How sportsbooks are evaluating Ole Miss and the College Football Playoff race, and more on NFL underdogs winning big on Thanksgiving.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: Women's Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Awful in first half, magic in second: Joshua Zirkzee leads Man United comeback
content: Man United and Joshua Zirkzee had a poor first half vs. Crystal Palace, but one moment of magic turned everything around.

title: Liverpool needed Isak, Wirtz to ease pressure on Slot, and they did
content: A fine performance from Florian Wirtz and a first goal for Alexander Isak eased some pressure on Liverpool.

title: Week 13 winners and losers: Bijan Robinson runs wild, Davante Adams makes history
content: Bijan Robinson, A.J. Brown and Patrick Mahomes led the way with big Week 13 performances, while Lamar Jackson, Saquon Barkley and Jaxon Smith-Njigba were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Kentucky fires Mark Stoops: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: Stoops departs after 13 years at Kentucky, leaving behind a job that could attract some interesting candidates.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 14, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to move for Real Madrid's Valverde
content: Manchester United are exploring a move for Real Madrid midfielder Federico Valverde. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Maharashtra woman ‚Äòmarries‚Äô corpse after kin kill man she loved over caste differences
content: Videos of Aanchal Mamidwar‚Äôs act at the deceased youth‚Äôs house and her call for her family to be hanged for the killing went viral on social media

title: ATF price hiked by 5.4%, commercial LPG rates cut
content: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum revise Aviation Turbine Fuel and Liquefied Petroleum Gas prices on the first day of every month based on international benchmarks and the exchange rate

title: Decathlon opens multi-sport ecosystem at Whitefield in Bengaluru
content: The 60,000 sqft store can host coaching sessions for basketball, football, skating, pickleball, and gymnastics, along with workshops, a kids‚Äô zone, a yoga and dance studio, weekly cycling and running meetups, sports birthday parties

title: Supreme Court declines to entertain plea for time extension to upload waqf details on UMEED portal
content: Supreme Court emphasises adherence to UMEED portal deadlines, allowing petitioners to seek relief from the waqf tribunal amid concerns over technical issues hindering property registration

title: BJP-ally IPFT to maintain separate political entity: Party president Prem Kumar Reang
content: The statement came days after the Tipra Motha Party organised a rally under the banner of 'One North East'

title: Watch: Israel‚Äôs Netanyahu seeks pardon in years-long corruption trial
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally submitted a pardon request amid ongoing corruption trials, calling the long-running cases ‚Äútearing the country apart‚Äù.

title: Tamil Nadu government and iVP Semi launch ‚ÄòTN 100 Chip Varsity‚Äô project to build semiconductor talent network
content: The project has a dual mandate: enabling the development of 100 new chip designs and training 5,000 students in advanced semiconductor design skills annually.

title: Bomb threats to Kerala CM‚Äôs residence, private bank in capital city ahead of President‚Äôs visit
content: E-mail received by Chief Minister‚Äôs Office reportedly claimed that RDX explosives have been planted by a group involving LTTE and a Karachi-based Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) cell. Police launch extensive checks

title: India's manufacturing sector activity falls to 9-month low in November on softer rise in sales, production: PMI
content: The seasonally adjusted HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers‚Äô Index (PMI) fell from 59.2 in October to 56.6 in November, highlighting the slowest improvement in operating conditions since February

title: Rajya Sabha witnesses heated exchange as Kharge brings up former V-P Dhankhar‚Äôs ‚Äòsudden exit‚Äô
content: LoP Kharge brought up the ‚Äúcompletely unexpected and sudden exit‚Äù of Jagdeep Dhankhar from the office of the Chair of Rajya Sabha

title: Supreme Court to hear plea against forcing Tamil Nadu Anganwadi workers into BLO work under threat of punishment, job loss
content: Senior advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan said Anganwadi workers were under ‚Äúsevere pressure‚Äù to attain ‚Äútargets‚Äù in the distribution of enumeration forms for the SIR

title: Thane court acquits all seven accused in cable theft case filed under MCOCA
content: Special MCOCA court judge V.G. Mohite ruled that the entire chain of evidence suffered from major legal and procedural lapses

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrests close aide of jailed Akali leader Bikram Majithia
content: Harpreet Singh Gulati, who is in the liquor trade, was arrested on Saturday, they said. During the probe, the Bureau detected a transaction of ‚Çπ10 crore between Gulati's companies and firms run by the Majithia family

title: Opposition using Parliament to vent out frustration: PM Modi
content: PM Modi said the session must not become a stage for political theatrics but a platform for constructive and result-driven debate

title: ED notice to Kerala CM ‚Äòa joke‚Äô, says KPCC chief Sunny Joseph
content: Sunny Joseph says the notice will have ‚Äòsame plight as previous¬†ones‚Äô issued by ED against Chief Minister and his son

title: Mayawati calls for smooth Winter Session of Parliament to address key public issues
content: In a post on X, the former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister cautioned that, like previous sessions, the Winter Session is expected to witness considerable uproar

title: India evacuates last batch of stranded citizens from Sri Lanka, intensifies relief efforts
content: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, the last batch of 104 Indian passengers stranded at Bandaranaike International Airport in Colombo reached Thiruvananthapuram, onboard an IAF aircraft

title: VMRDA sets May 2026 deadline for seven road projects linking Vizag to Bhogapuram airport
content: Road projects have slowed down owing to land acquisition challenges, with the toughest hurdle being the takeover of 75 acres; on the other hand, validation flight at the international airport is scheduled to take place this month

title: CM Rio renews demand to lift Protected Area Permit regime from Nagaland
content: The CM said that although the Centre has relaxed the PAP requirement for Nagaland from December 1 to 10 to facilitate the Hornbill Festival, the temporary measure "does not solve the larger issue"

title: ED issues show-cause notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in KIIFB masala bond probe
content: Former Finance Minister T.M. Thomas Isaac and KIIFB Chief Executive Officer K.M. Abraham too receive notices. ED notice is related to alleged use of funds raised through the bonds to purchase land and alleged violation of FEMA norms

title: Mamata to scale up anti-SIR campaign with rallies in Malda, Murshidabad, Cooch Behar
content: This marks Ms. Banerjee's second phase of anti-SIR mobilisation after her Bongaon rally last week in the refugee-dominated Matua belt

title: In Kothamangalam, LDF banks on legacy, UDF on unity, and BJP on change
content: The LDF is seeking to retain the municipality for a second consecutive term; The UDF is confident of wresting back power by presenting a united front.

title: Kerala local body election: Factionalism, poor candidate selection cost Congress dear in 2020 polls, says Mullappally Ramachandran
content: Former KPCC chief feels that candidate selection should not be left to the whims of individual leaders. He says differences among top leaders would dampen the spirits of grassroots-level workers and hence they should be resolved at the earliest

title: Kerala local body polls: Echoes of landslide in Meppadi‚Äôs electioneering
content: Survivors of the 2024 tragedy will return from various parts of Wayanad, where they now live in rented houses, to cast their votes. As the polls approach, we focus on  candidates themselves, not their parties, because none of them seems any different, says a survivor

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:  Thrissur sees a political ‚Äòpooram‚Äô ahead of polls
content: LDF‚Äôs development pitch, UDF‚Äôs revival push, and BJP‚Äôs expanding footprint are setting the stage for one of the most anticipated civic battle in the State

title: Still prefer to call Bangladesh a friend, hope situation there turns around: CNS Admiral Tripathi
content: The CNS said that he remains eternally optimistic and confident that things will turn around as far as Bangladesh is concerned

title: NIA raids eight locations in Kashmir in 'white-collar terror' module case
content: The NIA teams conducted searches at eight locations in Pulwama, Shopian and Kulgam districts of Kashmir

title: Extension of deadline for Special Intensive Revision of poll roll welcome: councillors
content: A councillor says that some BLOs want the process to be done quickly, as this work keeps them away from their civic responsibilities

title: Councillors call for return to zone-wise roadwork tenders
content: A councillor says that when a single contractor handles multiple areas, some places receive less attention; he alleges that contractors with connections to ruling party often dodge responsibilities

title: Parliament Winter Session: Sitaraman introduces two bills in Lok Sabha to replace GST cess on tobacco, pan masala with new levies
content: The Central Excise Amendment Bill, 2025, and The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, will ensure that the tax incidence on sin goods like tobacco and pan masala remains the same after discontinuation of the compensation cess

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of India of leaking info to BJP leaders
content: From day one, Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders have created a sense of fear among common people by repeatedly claiming that one crore names will be removed from the voter list in the state, TMC MP Partha Bhowmik said

title: A wall that connects, in a flood that‚Äôs wrecked life and livelihood
content: More than three months after floods submerged this village and large parts of the State, reptiles and insects, some poisonous, now live in the water, making this strip of wall both a lifeline and a hazard for these families.

title: SIR extension proves that the revision is a hurried process, says Trinamool
content: The EC on Sunday announced the extension of the schedule of the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls in nine States and three Union Territories by one week

title: Young candidates infuse new energy into poll campaign
content: Political parties are fielding young candidates, some as young as 21 or still in college, who are taking on seasoned politicians and bringing much-needed enthusiasm to the local body elections

title: BJP has been ‚Äòsplitting parties‚Äô for its entire history: Maharashtra minister
content: He said, the BJP poached one of his family members during the Assembly elections and has since poached a member of MP Rajabhau Waze‚Äôs family

title: West Bengal government directs digitisation of waqf properties on UMEED portal
content: ‚ÄòExisting Registered Waqf Properties‚Äô are to be uploaded by the respective mutawallis within six months from the date of launch of the UMEED portal, the State government has said

title: Bangladeshi nationals leave India via Hakimpur border checkpost amid rising SIR fears
content: Many say they are returning after watching videos of departure and fearing arrest under ongoing SIR exercise

title: Top leaders add zest to campaigning in Kozhikode Corporation
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan, Congress Working Committee member Ramesh Chennithala, and senior BJP leader V.K. Sajeevan join candidates as campaigning peaks

title: Assam CM is stoking conflict, says Gaurav Gogoi

title: Fearing Exodus Of Rich, Switzerland Votes To Reject Inheritance Tax
content: Switzerland voted to reject a 50% inheritance tax on super-rich residents after wealthy entrepreneurs threatened to leave the country. The plan was opposed by 78.3% of the electorate, according to government data on Sunday.

title: Australia High-School Teacher Admits Repeated Sex With 15-Year-Old Student

title: Australian Woman Channels Grief Of Son's Death Into Social Media Ban
content: Mia Bannister's skin is inked with a eulogy to her teenage son Ollie, whose suicide after a battle with anorexia and online bullying pushed her to fight for world-first laws in Australia to get children off social media.

title: "PM Modi Delivered Drama Instead Of Addressing Core Issues": M Kharge

title: Long Hours, Little Pay, Extreme Pressure: What It Means To Be A Booth Officer (BLO)

title: Birder alerts about Rock Eagle Owl nest; quarrying stopped for a month
content: Sudhakar Reddy Udumula is the Editor (Investigation) at the Times of India, Hyderabad. Following the trail of migration and drought across the rustic landscape of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, Sudhakar reported extensively on government apathy, divisive politics, systemic gender discrimination, agrarian crisis and the will to survive great odds. His curiosity for peeking behind the curtain triumphed over the criminal agenda of many scamsters in the highest political and corporate circles, making way for breaking stories such as Panama Papers Scam, Telgi Stamp Paper Scam, and many others. His versatility in reporting extended to red corridors of left-wing extremism where the lives of security forces and the locals in Maoist-affected areas were key points of investigation. His knack for detail provided crucial evidence of involvement from overseas in terrorist bombings in Hyderabad. Read More
